bioghist.p: William A. Oliver, Jr. (1926-2005) was a collector of books, manuscripts, and other items related to Charles Dickens, and particularly to his unfinished story "The Mystery of Edwin Drood."

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of material collected by William Oliver in conjunction with his research on "The Mystery of Edwin Drood." The collection includes correspondence, as well as original journals and magazines in which the serialization of the story or articles about this story appeared. The collection also includes Oliver’s bibliographic files, posters and programs related to productions of a play based on the story, Oliver’s travel files, maps, issues of newsletters from Dickensian organizations, as well as Dickensian ephemera and realia.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
